intro: Ocimum racemosum, commonly known as wild basil or Indian basil, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a strong, spicy scent. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pale purple to white, and it produces small, oblong fruits containing seeds. Ocimum racemosum is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
